Name: Athena
Description: This terracotta statue, coming  from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Herakleopolis Magna, represents the goddess Athena standing, the left leg bent. She is wearing the peplos refolded at the height of the waist and fixed by a belt. In the left hand, she clutches an oval shield. The right hand was probably holding a weapon or an attribute. This representation of the goddess Athena, who was assimilated to Neith and to Taweret, is strongly influenced by  Greek statuary.
